Our goal is to make your child s visit to Vann Pediatric Dental a great experience. Our job is to teach your child how to take care of their teeth and how to enjoy dental visits. Everything in the office has been created with your child in mind.  From the pirate ship in the waiting area, to the artwork on the walls, everything down to the taste of the toothpaste has them in mind. Dr. Vann takes time to talk to you about your child’s unique dental needs and to discuss your concerns.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Welcome to Birmingham Orthodontics! We have been providing affordable, quality orthodontic care since we were founded by Dr Michael McCarthy in 1993. Located in Alabaster, Hoover, and Trussville Alabama, our practice’s top priority is to provide our patients with a smile they deserve! We recognize that every patient has different needs, and we pride ourselves in the courteous service we deliver to each person who walks through our doors. We know a person’s self image is so important to them and a smile can last a lifetime. That is why it is our goal to offer braces and aligners at a price you can afford! We offer braces with no down payment and low monthly payments. Whether you’re an adult, adolescent or child, our knowledgeable doctors and staff are committed to helping you achieve the smile you deserve - a healthy, beautiful one. Please visit our website www.BhamSmile.com to learn more about our practice and locations.

Addressing your individual needs is priority number one at Moulton Dentistry. When there's a dental service you need, chances are high that you can find it under one roof when you visit Dr. Marc Moulton! His preventive treatments, including cleanings, exams, X-rays and oral cancer screenings ensure that if a dental problem appears, we catch it sooner rather than later. Of course, his restorative, cosmetic, emergency and sedation dentistry can help you restore, enhance and manage your dental concerns in a calming office environment. He gladly accepts dental insurance from many different providers and offers an in-house membership savings plan for those lacking insurance but in need of treatment. Feel free to call his office to get started!

We make high quality dental care convenient and affordable at our Vital Smiles office located near you. Our friendly and experienced dental professionals provide a wide range of family dental services including orthodontics, cosmetic dentistry and emergency dental care. Our general dentists, specialists and hygienists are all under one roof. Which means that treatment for implants, braces, or periodontal care can take place in the same office. Here, we gladly treat patients of all ages, including young children. We also welcome walk-ins, offer evening and weekend appointments, and accept a variety of dental plans including Medicaid and ALL Kids. FREE exams and x-rays for new patients.

WELCOME TO OAK MOUNTAIN ORTHODONTICS Orthodontist Priscila Denny, DMD and her expert orthodontic team provide you with a fun, comfortable environment in which to obtain top-notch orthodontic care. We offer the most current orthodontic treatment including traditional metal braces, InvisalignÂ® aligners, ceramic braces, and more. Contact us to get started on a great smile today! Our Birmingham orthodontic office serves the areas of Birmingham, Riverchase, and Pelham at 2029 Old Montgomery Highway, only minutes from Riverchase Middle and Elementary Schools. Our Helena orthodontic office also serves Helena and Alabaster areas at 4730 Highway 17, next to Publix and close to Helena Middle and Intermediate Schools.

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Operational for more than 72 years, Narrows Family Dentistry offers oral care services. Located in Birmingham, Ala., the center's services include dental/deep cleanings, composite filings, crowns, bridges, partial dentures, complete dentures, extractions, root canals, pediatric dentistry and cosmetic services. Additionally, it provides cosmetic services, including veneers, porcelain crowns, bridges, teeth whitening and implant crowns, to name a few. Narrows Family Dentistry is a provider for Aetna, MetLife, Delta Dental, Blue Cross blue Shield Association, Guardian and Cigna.

Extensive experience, ongoing education, and state of the art technology means that you will find quality dental care at Baldone Family Dentistry. Whether you are in need of care to maintain or restore your smile and good dental health, we are a professional dental team offering the perfect blend of experience, training, and genuine care to keep you smiling for a lifetime. We are located at 511 Brookwood Boulevard in Birmingham, adjacent to Brookwood Hospital, and we are open 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Thursday and 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. every other Friday. ABOUT OUR DOCTORS & STAFF Charles J. Baldone, D.M.D., joined the practice of his father, Joseph C.Baldone, D.M.D. in 1987. "Dr. Joe" retired in 2001 after more than 45 years of practice, and was a wonderful example for his son of practicing dentistry for the life of the patient, and keeping the long term goals of the patient in mind. Charles J. Baldone, D.M.D., graduated from the University of Alabama with a B.S. in Chemistry, and received his DMD degree from the University of Alabama School of Dentistry. He is currently a member of the 7th district of the Alabama and American Dental Association. He is a member of the Academy of General Dentistry and is active in two local dental study clubs. Spencer Moore, D.M.D., joined the practice in 2006. He received a B.S. degree in Biochemistry from the University of Mississippi, and his D.M.D. degree from the University of Mississippi. Our hygienists are Cindy Powers-Kidd and Julie Marsh, both with RDH licenses with the state of Alabama. Combined together, they have more than 25 years of experience in the field of dental hygiene.

Michael Anglin, D.D.S. is an orthodontist clinic with specialized skills to address the oral health needs of children and adolescents. Located in Birmingham, Ala., the office comprises of a playroom with child friendly books, toys and television; homework room for patient's family members while waiting; conference room for parents; and eight state-of-the-art operatories each with laptop computer to allow quick treatment planning, billing and check-out. The clinic has state-of-the-art equipment, including drill-free fillings and laser cavity detection. In addition, Michael Anglin, D.D.S. provides nitrous oxide as well as conscious sedation to make the dental treatments more relaxing.

Our goal is to make your child s visit to Vann Pediatric Dental a great experience. Our job is to teach your child how to take care of their teeth and how to enjoy dental visits. Everything in the office has been created with your child in mind.  From the pirate ship in the waiting area, to the artwork on the walls, everything down to the taste of the toothpaste has them in mind.  There are even ceiling mounted televisions for the patients to watch while they have their teeth cleaned. Dr. Vann takes time to talk to you about your child’s unique dental needs and to discuss your concerns.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Addressing your individual needs is priority number one at Moulton Dentistry. Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Operational for more than 72 years, Narrows Family Dentistry offers oral care services. Additionally, it provides cosmetic services, including veneers, porcelain crowns, bridges, teeth whitening and implant crowns, to name a few. Charles J. Baldone, D.M.D., graduated from the University of Alabama with a B.S. in Chemistry, and received his DMD degree from the University of Alabama School of Dentistry. Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Operational for more than 72 years, Narrows Family Dentistry offers oral care services. Located in Birmingham, Ala., the center's services include dental/deep cleanings, composite filings, crowns, bridges, partial dentures, complete dentures, extractions, root canals, pediatric dentistry and cosmetic services. Additionally, it provides cosmetic services, including veneers, porcelain crowns, bridges, teeth whitening and implant crowns, to name a few. Extensive experience, ongoing education, and state of the art technology means that you will find quality dental care at Baldone Family Dentistry. Whether you are in need of care to maintain or restore your smile and good dental health, we are a professional dental team offering the perfect blend of experience, training, and genuine care to keep you smiling for a lifetime. We are located at 511 Brookwood Boulevard in Birmingham, adjacent to Brookwood Hospital, and we are open 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Thursday and 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. every other Friday. ABOUT OUR DOCTORS & STAFF Charles J. Baldone, D.M.D., joined the practice of his father, Joseph C.Baldone, D.M.D. in 1987. "Dr. Joe" retired in 2001 after more than 45 years of practice, and was a wonderful example for his son of practicing dentistry for the life of the patient, and keeping the long term goals of the patient in mind. Charles J. Baldone, D.M.D., graduated from the University of Alabama with a B.S. in Chemistry, and received his DMD degree from the University of Alabama School of Dentistry. He is currently a member of the 7th district of the Alabama and American Dental Association. He is a member of the Academy of General Dentistry and is active in two local dental study clubs. Spencer Moore, D.M.D., joined the practice in 2006. He received a B.S. degree in Biochemistry from the University of Mississippi, and his D.M.D. degree from the University of Mississippi. Our hygienists are Cindy Powers-Kidd and Julie Marsh, both with RDH licenses with the state of Alabama. Combined together, they have more than 25 years of experience in the field of dental hygiene.

The clinic has state-of-the-art equipment, including drill-free fillings and laser cavity detection. In addition, Michael Anglin, D.D.S. provides nitrous oxide as well as conscious sedation to make the dental treatments more relaxing.

Business Name: Cook Family and Cosmetic Dentistry: Aaron Cook, DMD
Business Information: Our wide array of services are designed to offer treatments that improve your oral health and give you a smile that lets your true beauty shine through. You can count on us to provide you with all the information you need to make informed decisions about your dental care so there are never any surprises.  At Cook Family and Cosmetic Dentistry, we don’t offer one-size-fits-all solutions. We recognize you as the unique individual you are, and we will work with you to find conservative, affordable treatments that fit your dental needs, budget, and lifestyle.  We are all here because we want to show you the difference that a healthy smile can make to your life. Each member of our team is dedicated to delivering exceptional oral health care with a kind touch and concern for your well-being. We believe that you deserve our full attention, and we will take all the time necessary to answer your questions about dental care.  Obtaining quality dental care should never feel like a hassle. We offer early morning hours to accommodate your busy schedule, and visiting us is a breeze with our convenient, close-in parking. If you experience a dental emergency, we will do our best to fit you in the same day. For an after-hours emergency, please call our office number for instructions on how to get in touch with us.  Financial considerations should never get in the way of your oral health care. We are contracted with a number of dental insurance providers, but we will file all insurance claims. If you are uninsured, we’ve got you covered! We are happy to offer CareCredit and Healthy Smiles, a reduced-fee dental plan.  We would love to welcome you to our comfortable Birmingham dental office for a visit. We look forward to meeting you and your family!

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

UAB Hospital is a major center for clinical research and the home of some of the top medical programs in America. Our faculty physicians, nursing staff, and support personnel are committed to providing world-class care to every patient.

Alabama Periodontics, the office of Dr. Brett Maddux in Birmingham, AL. We are a periodontal office dedicated to improving the health, beauty, and function of your smile. Periodontists are specialists with three additional years of training in the the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal disease and the placement of dental implants. Periodontal (gum) disease is a preventable disease of the gums that can lead to tooth loss and decay. Recent studies have linked periodontal disease to serious health complications like stroke, heart disease, and premature birth. If you have been told you have gum disease, it is important that you seek treatment right away. Our office is conveniently located in Birmingham, AL. We are a group of of professionals dedicated to providing each of our patients with exceptional care in a comfortable, relaxing setting. Dr. Maddux is a LANAP certified clinician. The LANAP Laser Treatment is the first and only FDA cleared laser protocol for the treatment of moderate to severe periodontal disease. Call Us Today!

Hugh P. Brindley, D.M.D. has been in the private practice of Oral and Maxillofacial surgery in Birmingham and Cullman for over 30 years. He is Board Certified by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Fellow of the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, Board Certified by the National Board of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the American Cleft Palate Association, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Anesthesiology, a member of the Alabama Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a member of the Southeastern Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.  Dr. Brindley graduated from Cullman High School in 1963. He received his B.S. degree from Samford University in 1967. He graduated with honors from UAB School of Dentistry in 1971. He served in the U.S. Navy Dental Corps from 1971 to 1973 stationed with the USMC during the Vietnam War receiving a Certificate of Commendation from Gen. Robert H. Barrow, later Commandant of the USMC. He returned to UAB in 1973 where he received his Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery {OMS} training and certification. He served as chief resident in OMS at UAB in 1976. He served as adjunct clinical professor of OMS at UAB School of Dentistry for 8 years. He has been the chief of OMS at St. Vincent’s East and Medical Center East since 1977. He is currently on the active hospital staff of St. Vincent’s East hospital and on the courtesy staff of St. Vincent’s Birmingham. He is a contributing author, writing two chapters in two major texts on trauma and impacted teeth. He has published numerous articles in periodicals on OMS. His other diverse interests and activities include a member of Birmingham East Rotary Club for over 20 years and founder and club sponsor of the Leg-up Scholarship program. He is a member of St. John’s UMC where he served as Choral Director for 10 years. He has participated in Mega-missions medical missions to Mexico. He founded and heads Brindley Productions Ltd., a video production company. He is a member of numerous other local, regional and international organizations. Dr. Brindley moved his practice in 2002 to the new “state-of-the-art” outpatient facility at Medical Center East, now St. Vincent’s East hospital where he maintains his practice as well as his office in Cullman, Alabama. He and his wife Carole married in 1967 and now have two daughters and 7 grandchildren.

Operational for more than 72 years, Narrows Family Dentistry offers oral care services. ABOUT OUR DOCTORS & STAFF Charles J. Baldone, D.M.D., joined the practice of his father, Joseph C.Baldone, D.M.D. in 1987. Charles J. Baldone, D.M.D., graduated from the University of Alabama with a B.S. in Chemistry, and received his DMD degree from the University of Alabama School of Dentistry. Spencer Moore, D.M.D., joined the practice in 2006. He received a B.S. degree in Biochemistry from the University of Mississippi, and his D.M.D. degree from the University of Mississippi.
